metadata.synopsis: Shadowheart finally meets Nightsong. If Shadowheart is an Avatar, the player has the option to kill or free Nightsong. Shar will encourage the player to kill Nightsong using the Spear of Night.If the player is controlling a companion Shadowheart, Shadowheart will always choose to kill Nightsong.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1.Talk to Nightsong while controlling Shadowheart - either as a companion or an Avatar2. Talk to Nightsong while Shadowheart is a companion

20.speaker: Nightsong
20.text: Balthazar has drawn his final rancid breath. A pity it was not my hand that brought it about. Instead, it was you.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.InternalNodeContext: This node if Balthazar was attacked in a scene just before this one.

138.speaker: Nightsong
138.text: You, who have come to find the wicked favour of your goddess. Go on - show me your dagger, your sword, your knife.
138.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'go on' she points at SH, triggering the magical hands that keep her held in place.

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *Your worship of Lady Shar, out in the open at last. You managed to keep the secret from those around you for so long... but no more.*
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart flinches at the sound of Shar's angry voiceNodeContext: Wrathful goddess chastising her follower's error

22.speaker: Shar
22.text: What have you done? The spear, foolish child - you don't have the spear!
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart flinches at the sound of Shar's angry voiceNodeContext: Wrathful goddess chastising her follower's error

173.speaker: Nightsong
173.text: There is much your mistress does not tell you - my death will come at a terrible price. One that you will not grasp until it is too late.
173.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart flinches slightly at the sound of Shar's voiceNodeContext: Reassuring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

191.speaker: Nightsong
191.text: Do you know what I am, little assassin? For I know you - a lost child, frightened by wolves in the dark.
191.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart flinches slightly at the sound of Shar's voiceNodeContext: Reassuring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart flinches slightly at the sound of Shar's voiceNodeContext: Reassuring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

82.speaker: Nightsong
82.text: Much has been promised to you, hasn't it? But what has been taken from you? What do you know of your own heart - your own life?

190.speaker: Nightsong
190.text: I sense more in you than you know. Why?

127.speaker: Shadowheart
127.text: You are an enemy to the Lady of Loss. Nothing else matters.
127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart flinches slightly at the sound of Shar's voiceNodeContext: Reassuring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

63.speaker: Nightsong
63.text: I am Dame Aylin. Out of this hellish realm I carry my sword by the blessing of my mother, Selûne.

171.speaker: Nightsong
171.text: The very sight of me would disgust you if you were a true Sharran. But you, perhaps, are something more.

180.speaker: Shadowheart
180.text: You don't frighten me. Now keep out of my head.
180.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart flinches slightly at the sound of Shar's voiceNodeContext: Reassuring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

141.speaker: Nightsong
141.text: Look at me. I am at your mercy. To frighten you would only hasten my demise.
141.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart flinches slightly at the sound of Shar's voiceNodeContext: Reassuring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

24.speaker: Nightsong
24.text: I sense something in you, assassin. Something your Dark Lady fears.
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart flinches slightly at the sound of Shar's voiceNodeContext: Reassuring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

67.speaker: Shar
67.text: Do not listen, Shadowheart. She seeks to distract, to confuse, to prolong her ugly existence and deny you your destiny. Shut out her words.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart flinches slightly at the sound of Shar's voiceNodeContext: Reassuring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

39.speaker: Nightsong
39.text: Shar speaks now, doesn't she? Dribbles the poison of oblivion in the shell of your ear? I do not hear her words, but I sense her rage.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

58.text: If I spare you, you'll tell me what you know?
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

169.text: If I spare you, you'll tell me what you know?

81.speaker: Shadowheart
81.text: If I spare you, you'll tell me what you know?

109.speaker: Nightsong
109.text: You must do more than spare me. You must free me.

76.speaker: Nightsong
76.text: Ketheric Thorm - once a servant of your goddess, now a faithless wretch - has used me to make himself immortal for a hundred years.

110.speaker: Nightsong
110.text: Free me  - lay a hand upon me in friendship. I will end him - and I will lay your path at your feet. Then, you must walk it.

156.speaker: Shar
156.text: Enough. Close your heart to her craven words. Strike! Strike and rise!

157.speaker: Nightsong
157.text: There, I feel her again. Why does she fear truth more than I fear death?

103.speaker: Shadowheart
103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart casts the spear away.

196.text: Your past is not yet lost. Your future is not yet fixed.
196.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart casts the spear away.

164.speaker: Nightsong
164.text: Your past is not yet lost. Your future is not yet fixed.
164.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, Shadowheart lays a hand on her shoulder

187.speaker: Nightsong
187.text: Lay a hand on me in friendship, not-quite-Sharran, and I will fight the battle that has been waiting for me this last century. Then - oh then, we will have much to discuss.
187.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, Shadowheart lays a hand on her shoulder

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: End her words with the Spear of Night.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart thrusts the spear forward, right into Nightsong's heart. Her hands and  forearms are coated in Nightsong's blood. She releases the spear, leaving it protruding from Nightsong's torso.

125.text: There it is. True death, at last. You are Shar's child after all. And I am... I am...
125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart thrusts the spear forward, right into Nightsong's heart. Her hands and  forearms are coated in Nightsong's blood. She releases the spear, leaving it protruding from Nightsong's torso.

11.text: There it is. True death, at last. You are Shar's child after all. And I am... I am...
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong falls, dead. Shadowheart exhales, trembling.

132.speaker: Nightsong
132.text: There it is. True death, at last. You are Shar's child after all. And I am... I am...
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong falls, dead. Shadowheart exhales, trembling.

21.speaker: Shar
21.text: It is done. You have proven yourself. You have answered my highest calling. My Chosen. My Warrior. My Dark Justiciar.

136.speaker: Shar
136.text: No more hiding. Let me show you - let all see how you have served me, Shadowheart. And how you have been rewarded.

96.text: Your pain is now your power. Wield it true.
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: A black sphere suddenly envelopes Shadowheart. She finds herself in a strange, dark nowhere. A black disc with a fringe of purple glow, almost like an eclipse, appears before her, forming Shar's symbol. Just barely visible within the disc is what appear to be a figure, arms outstretched to the sides, as if suspended from the disc itself. The wound on Shadowheart's hand glows - only this time, she does not wince in pain. The wild, flickering magic slows and coalesces into a black magic sphere balanced upon her hand. She stares at it with awe and a little trepidation.

137.text: Your pain is now your power. Wield it true.
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dark sphere in Shadowheart's hand expands, engulfing her, filling the entire space with darkness. Then it recedes, revealing Shadowheart, transformed. Her hair has changed - more elaborate now, threaded with purple-tinged metals. She wears the full armour of a Dark Justiciar, but no dusty relic - an immaculate, dark metal. The sphere reduces down in size, controlled in her palm.

36.speaker: Shar
36.text: Your pain is now your power. Wield it true.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dark sphere in Shadowheart's hand expands, engulfing her, filling the entire space with darkness. Then it recedes, revealing Shadowheart, transformed. Her hair has changed - more elaborate now, threaded with purple-tinged metals. She wears the full armour of a Dark Justiciar, but no dusty relic - an immaculate, dark metal. The sphere reduces down in size, controlled in her palm.

152.text: My church must be cleansed. You shall be my instrument in ridding it of the impure, then you shall take up the mantle as its new leader.
152.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dark sphere in Shadowheart's hand expands, engulfing her, filling the entire space with darkness. Then it recedes, revealing Shadowheart, transformed. Her hair has changed - more elaborate now, threaded with purple-tinged metals. She wears the full armour of a Dark Justiciar, but no dusty relic - an immaculate, dark metal. The sphere reduces down in size, controlled in her palm.

124.speaker: Shar
124.text: My church must be cleansed. You shall be my instrument in ridding it of the impure, then you shall take up the mantle as its new leader.

97.speaker: Shar
97.text: First, punish the traitor, Ketheric Thorm. He shunned my embrace. He let my armies be slaughtered. He used my domain to safeguard his wretched life.

14.speaker: Shar
14.text: But now, without the Nightsong, he is vulnerable. End him, in my name, Shadowheart. Let him see you in your splendour, before you shut his eyes forever.

143.speaker: Shar
143.text: Once he is vanquished, Baldur's Gate awaits. Your holy work will continue there, where you first learned of my embrace. Take up my spear again and go forth. Let the cleansing begin.

183.speaker: Narrator
183.text: *Lady Shar's parting words echo with resurgent power - your sacrifice of the Nightsong has strengthened her. Her grip tightens on the lands. The Selûnite enclave at haven shall be no more...*
183.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart gazes upwards, as if towards the surface world high above.

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: If I spare you, you'll tell me what you know?
48.context: NodeContext: Imploring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

160.speaker: Nightsong
160.text: You must do more than spare me. You must free me.
160.context: NodeContext: Imploring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

105.speaker: Nightsong
105.text: Ketheric Thorm - once a servant of your goddess, now a faithless wretch - has used me to make himself immortal for a hundred years.
105.context: NodeContext: Imploring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

54.speaker: Nightsong
54.text: Free me  - lay a hand upon me in friendship. I will end him - and I will lay your path at your feet. Then, you must walk it.
54.context: NodeContext: Imploring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

35.speaker: Shar
35.text: Enough. Close your heart to her. She only seeks to hold you back. Make the sacrifice. Do it for me, Shadowheart.
35.context: NodeContext: Imploring and soothing, yet with an edge beneath the surface. (urging Shadowheart to sacrifice someone)

189.speaker: Nightsong
189.text: There, I feel her again. Why does she fear truth more than I fear death?

159.speaker: Shadowheart
159.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, Shadowheart lays a hand on her shoulder

71.speaker: Nightsong
71.text: Your past is not yet lost. Your future is not yet fixed.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, Shadowheart lays a hand on her shoulder

184.speaker: Nightsong
184.text: Lay a hand on me in friendship, not-quite-Sharran, and I will fight the battle that has been waiting for me this last century. Then - oh then, we will have much to discuss.
184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, Shadowheart lays a hand on her shoulder

0.speaker: Shadowheart
0.text: You must die. Shar wills it.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, Shadowheart lays a hand on her shoulder

15.speaker: Nightsong
15.text: You cannot. You will not. Without your spear, you are as a lamb before a lion.
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, Shadowheart lays a hand on her shoulder

60.speaker: Nightsong
60.text: Lay your hand on me - free me from this prison - and you will have proven me most wrong.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, Shadowheart lays a hand on her shoulder

62.speaker: Shar
62.text: My spear, child - pierce her heart, and become my sword hand. My Dark Justiciar.
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.NodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.

89.speaker: Nightsong
89.text: Well, well, well. What's that I sense? A spear intended for my heart. Empowered by your goddess, aye - empowered to kill the child of a god.
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.NodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.

25.speaker: Nightsong
25.text: At last. What took you so long, little Sharran?
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.

37.speaker: Nightsong
37.text: I have felt you coming. The first in a century.
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.

139.speaker: Nightsong
139.text: You, who have come to seek the praise of your wicked goddess. You, who have come to drive a dagger through my heart.
139.context: CinematicNodeContext: She continues pacing, watching her feet, but slams her open palm against her heart.

108.speaker: Shadowheart
108.text: Not a dagger - a spear. My Lady Shar's spear.

4.speaker: Shadowheart
4.text: It is my Lady Shar's will. You should be honoured to be a part of her plan - I know I am.

179.speaker: Shadowheart
179.text: Her fate is mine to seal. Let me handle this.

155.speaker: Nightsong
155.text: The fate you seal is your own. To be a Dark Justiciar is to turn your heart from everything but loss. You will know no love, no joy - only servitude.
155.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

79.speaker: Nightsong
79.text: Until, of course, your mistress inevitably discards you. And there is much she does not tell you - a terrible blood price that may extend beyond my own death.
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

194.speaker: Narrator
194.text: *You feel Shadowheart bristling - this is important to her. But your bond is strong. You may yet be able to sway her from the path of duty to the path of light.*
194.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

165.speaker: Narrator
165.text: *You feel Shadowheart bristling - this is important to her. You may yet have the chance to dissuade her from doing her duty, but not without risk to your bond.*
165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *You feel Shadowheart bristling - this is important to her. Any attempts to dissuade her from doing her duty will be a damning blow to your bond.*
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *And Nightsong is not blind to your conflict. Behind that raging heart is the restless beat of one who knows too well that her fate hangs in the balance.*
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

52.speaker: Player
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

112.speaker: Player
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: Is this truly what you want?
170.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

98.speaker: Shadowheart
98.text: I... yes, I think so. My whole life's been leading to this. No turning back now.

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: Of course, why wouldn't it be? This is my purpose.

85.speaker: Shadowheart
85.text: If you knew me, you would not even ask. It is what my Lady wants - I'm just her servant.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Choose your own way, Shadowheart. You cannot allow your goddess to control you.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: All right, fine. Do as you will.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: No, it's not. Your life is whatever you make it - don't give up on yourself.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

53.text: I can't believe I did that - Shar will disown me. Now I'm truly lost...
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

114.text: I can't believe I did that - Shar will disown me. Now I'm truly lost...
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks down at her right hand, which glows like it does when her incurable wound flares - only this time she doesn't react to any pain. The Spear of Night materialises in her palm like a dark mirage.

83.text: I can't believe I did that - Shar will disown me. Now I'm truly lost...
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart pauses, torn, then flings the Spear of Night away.

181.speaker: Shadowheart
181.text: I can't believe I did that - Shar will disown me. Now I'm truly lost...
181.context: NodeContext: 'WTF did I just do?' adrenaline/shock

122.speaker: Nightsong
122.text: You were already lost, little warrior. A lost child, frightened by wolves.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Find a new purpose then. My mind is set.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.NodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.

151.speaker: Shadowheart
151.text: If I have to step over your corpse to fulfil what Lady Shar asks of me, so be it. Your choice.
151.context: CinematicNodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.NodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: All right. You have my support.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.NodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.

56.speaker: Nightsong
56.text: And what do you propose to do, little Sharran? With what weapon would you take the life of an immortal?
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.NodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.

174.context: CinematicNodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.NodeContext: Slight cock of her head, as if sensing something that is not yet visible.

26.speaker: Shadowheart

26.context: NodeContext: 'WTF did I just do?' adrenaline/shock

161.speaker: Nightsong
161.text: Not what will happen - what will you do. Your past is not yet lost. Your future is not yet fixed.
161.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, Shadowheart lays a hand on her shoulder

102.text: This is your choice. I can't make it for you.

198.speaker: Player
198.text: Let her live. Shar will never stop asking sacrifices of you.

5.text: Your pain is now your power. Wield it true.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dark sphere in Shadowheart's hand expands, engulfing her, filling the entire space with darkness. Then it recedes, revealing Shadowheart, transformed. Her hair has changed - more elaborate now, threaded with purple-tinged metals. She wears the full armour of a Dark Justiciar, but no dusty relic - an immaculate, dark metal. The sphere reduces down in size, controlled in her palm.

162.speaker: Shar
162.text: Your pain is now your power. Wield it true.
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dark sphere in Shadowheart's hand expands, engulfing her, filling the entire space with darkness. Then it recedes, revealing Shadowheart, transformed. Her hair has changed - more elaborate now, threaded with purple-tinged metals. She wears the full armour of a Dark Justiciar, but no dusty relic - an immaculate, dark metal. The sphere reduces down in size, controlled in her palm.

150.text: My church must be cleansed. You shall be my instrument in ridding it of the impure, then you shall take up the mantle as its new leader.
150.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dark sphere in Shadowheart's hand expands, engulfing her, filling the entire space with darkness. Then it recedes, revealing Shadowheart, transformed. Her hair has changed - more elaborate now, threaded with purple-tinged metals. She wears the full armour of a Dark Justiciar, but no dusty relic - an immaculate, dark metal. The sphere reduces down in size, controlled in her palm.

86.speaker: Shar
86.text: My church must be cleansed. You shall be my instrument in ridding it of the impure, then you shall take up the mantle as its new leader.
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: The vision scene dissolves as Shar's voice fades

57.speaker: Shar
57.text: First, hunt down the traitor, Ketheric Thorm. He shunned my embrace. He let my armies be slaughtered. He used my domain to safeguard his wretched life.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: The vision scene dissolves as Shar's voice fades

142.speaker: Shar
142.text: But now, without the Nightsong, he is vulnerable. End him, in my name, Shadowheart. Let him see you in your splendour, before you shut his eyes forever.
142.context: CinematicNodeContext: The vision scene dissolves as Shar's voice fades

77.speaker: Shar
77.text: Once he is vanquished, Baldur's Gate awaits. Your holy work will continue there, where you first learned of my embrace. Take up my spear again and go forth. Let the cleansing begin.
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: The vision scene dissolves as Shar's voice fades

30.text: Finally! Through me her will is enacted. Her shadows strengthen and the darkness takes all. I am her Chosen!
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gazing upwards with wonder torwards the surfaceNodeContext: Awestruck, gazing upwards. Experiencing a sort of religious ectasy/insight into her goddess's next move.

10.speaker: Nightsong
10.text: You cannot. You will not. Without your spear, you are as a lamb before a lion.
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, Shadowheart lays a hand on her shoulder

144.speaker: Nightsong
144.text: Lay your hand on me - free me from this prison - and you will have proven me most wrong.
144.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, Shadowheart lays a hand on her shoulder

87.speaker: Player
87.text: She knows something about you. Spare her, and see what she has to say.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Don't do it, Shadowheart. Don't kill her - you'll regret it.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Don't do it, Shadowheart. Don't kill her - you'll regret it.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: Don't do it, Shadowheart. Don't kill her - you'll regret it.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: She knows something about you. Spare her, and see what she has to say.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: This is wrong... but I can't afford to lose you. Do what you must.
188.context: NodeContext: Angry and resigned. Attacks the player immediately afterwards

50.speaker: Player
50.context: NodeContext: Angry and resigned. Attacks the player immediately afterwards

43.speaker: Shadowheart
43.text: I didn't want to fight. I wanted you to see reason. A foolish notion, clearly.
43.context: NodeContext: Angry and resigned. Attacks the player immediately afterwards

135.speaker: Shadowheart
135.text: Cannot allow...? This is my mistress' will - my life's purpose!

70.speaker: Nightsong
70.text: Balthazar has drawn his final rancid breath. A pity it was not my hand that brought it about. Instead, it was you.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.

100.speaker: Nightsong
100.text: At last. What took you so long, little Sharran?
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.

45.speaker: Nightsong
45.text: You cannot. You will not. Without your spear, you are as a lamb before a lion.
45.context: NodeContext: Distraught. Believes she's failed her life's goal

120.speaker: Shadowheart
120.text: I've... I've failed. Lady Shar will disown me... what will happen to me?
120.context: NodeContext: Distraught. Believes she's failed her life's goal

195.speaker: Nightsong
195.text: I have felt you coming, Sharran. The first in a century.
195.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.
